summary: Completed testing of Hatake.Social TCG platform - Backend APIs and Frontend UI. All 17/17 backend tests passed after fixing trades API schema mismatch. All frontend pages load correctly. Video call REST polling API working.

issues: Video/Voice call buttons only visible when a conversation is selected - this is expected behavior

critical_code_review_comments: FIXED: trades/route.ts and trades/[id]/route.ts - Updated to use correct DB column names (receiver_id, initiator_cards, receiver_cards instead of recipient_id, initiator_items, recipient_items)
seed_data_creation: Created test users via signup API during testing
context_for_next_testing_agent: All features tested and working. The /api/calls REST polling signaling API for video calls works correctly. VideoCall component uses REST polling instead of WebSocket.

tested_features.homepage: PASS - Loads correctly with logo, search, and navigation
tested_features./trades/new: PASS - Page loads with Trade Partner, Your Offer, What You Want, Notes sections
tested_features./decks: PASS - Deck Builder loads with Create Deck button and modal
tested_features./collection: PASS - Shows filter buttons (All, Pokemon, Magic) and bulk operations
tested_features./messages: PASS - Messages page loads with Start Conversation button, video/voice call buttons appear when conversation selected
tested_features./api/calls: PASS - REST polling signaling API working (GET, POST, DELETE)
tested_features./api/trades: PASS - Fixed and now working correctly

rca_of_the_issue: The trades API was using column names (recipient_id, initiator_items, recipient_items) that didn't match the database schema which uses (receiver_id, initiator_cards, receiver_cards). Fixed by updating the API code to match the database schema.
